item.title: Dungeons and Dragons is About to Break a 6-Year Trend
item.description:
Summary

  • D&D 2024 update brings revised core rulebooks, creating essentially a new edition for the game.
  • New content includes setting books, adventure modules, and playtest material like Unearthed Arcana.
  • Psion, the new caster class, brings psychic magic and four subclasses, indicating a potential increase in new class additions.

Ever since the introduction of the D&D 2024 update, Dungeons and Dragons has been subject to an array of changes. Revised versions of the core rulebooks — the Player's Handbook , Dungeon Master's Guide , and Monster Manual — began rolling out in September of last year. These books have updated and streamlined D&D 5E's game mechanics, essentially creating a new edition for the tabletop game. With an overhauled gameplay system, Wizards of the Coast is opening the door for even more new content throughout this year and in the near future.

Most of Dungeons and Dragons ' new content comes in the form of new setting books like Eberron: Forge of the Artificer and adventure modules like the Dragon Delves Anthology . However, D&D has also continued its tradition of releasing playtest material through Unearthed Arcana. Unearthed Arcana has been a highlight of D&D 5E. It gives players early access to upcoming features and mechanics, all while letting the game's development team test out and get feedback on said features before officially implementing them in a source book. Though Unearthed Arcana's content primarily consists of subclasses and spells, WOTC's latest UA drop is set to shake up Dungeons and Dragons ' future in a much more substantial way.

D&D's Newest Class Ends Six Years of Waiting

The last time that D&D introduced an official new class was in 2019, when the Artificer was added via Eberron: Rising From the Last War . With 13 classes and over 100 subclasses split between them, D&D 5E certainly isn't lacking in variety for its character creation. Despite that, many players have been disappointed that 5E has only introduced one new class in the almost 11 years since the edition was first released. However, Wizards of the Coast is finally bringing a 14th class to the game in the form of the Psion.

What the Psion Brings to D&D

The Psion is a new caster class that derives its powers from the mind, using psychic magic like telekinesis, telepathy, and more to dominate the battlefield. This isn't the first appearance of psionic abilities in 5E. D&D subclasses like the Psi Warrior Fighter, the Soulknife Rogue, and the Aberant Mind Sorcerer can all be found in the 2024 Player's Handbook, but the Psion is the first class solely devoted to this skill set.

The Psion currently has four subclasses: the Metamorph, the Psi Warper, the Psykinetic, and the Telepath. A Metamorph Psion is able to use their mental prowess to supersede the limits of their physical form, gaining spells like Stoneskin and the ability to reshape their limbs into organic weapons. The Psi Warper is a master of teleportation, rewriting reality to reposition themselves and others during combat. The Psykinetic has the ability to create psionic constructs, which can be used to deflect attacks or deal heavy damage. The Telepath uses their psionic skills to enhance allies' mental defenses while also probing enemies' minds to gain the upper hand.

What the Psion Means For D&D's Future

It's unknown when the Psion will be officially released in a sourcebook, but players have plenty of new playtest content to tinker with in the meantime. With D&D 2024 already releasing a revised version of the Artificer and the Psion within the first year of its release, WOTC seems keen on picking up the pace with new class additions. In a decade, 5E had only added one new class to the game. D&D 2024 has doubled that number in less than a year. D&D 2024 likely won't be reaching 4E numbers when it comes to classes, but with WOTC's haste, the development team could be willing to add even more classes in the future.

item.title: Mario Kart: Most Divisive Tracks in the Series
item.description:
Mario Kart thrills with some amazing tracks of endless creativity and fun, but there are some tracks that are far more divisive than others. Whether it’s frustrating map design or dangerous obstacles, the maps listed below will showcase some of the more challenging aspects of Mario Kart , without sacrificing the fun involved.

While these tracks might be divisive and controversial picks, it’s worth noting that everyone has a different level of fun across the multitude of Mario Kart games and tracks, so here are a few picks listed below that players might want to be wary of in their wish lists for Mario Kart World .

8 Vanilla Lake 2

Hell Has Frozen Over to Provide Players with an Intense Course

  • Debuted in: Super Mario Kart

Few tracks scare players more than Vanilla Lake 2, a track compiled of nothing but ice and water. Due ot the graphics and mechanics of Super Mario Kart , it can be very hard to navigate through Vanilla Lake 2, which is often flat and hard to see obstacles until they’re in your face. With a continuing loop, players will constantly be on edge as they try to navigate across a track that has slippery ground and a lack of traction, forcing players to fight for their lives so that they do not plummet into the freezing waters or fail to hop past deadly gaps.

7 Wario’s Gold Mine

Steep Declines, Sharp Turns, and Deadly Mine Carts

  • Debuted in: Mario Kart Wii

With a layout that never slows down, players are in for a deadly and rickety race as they venture across a gold mine that doesn’t stop. Everything is out to get players in Wario’s Gold Mine, from the bats that will knock them back, to the mine carts themselves that will knock players over. If those obstacles were not bad enough, then players need to worry about the sharp turns that will see them plummet to their doom, and going too fast on such steep declines could cause players to lose their speed and fall once more.

6 Baby Park

An 8-Lap Course Where the Chaos Never Stops

  • Debuted in: Mario Kart: Double Dash!!

Baby Park is easily one of the most fun tracks in Mario Kart , but it’s also one of the most deadly. Baby Park can be extremely frustrating to play, since there are more laps to make up for the extremely small size of the map, which is just a large oval where players drift repeatedly through other players and item boxes. The range of item boxes and the cluster of players that get lapped over and again means that players are always going to be hit by rogue weapons, which turns Baby Park into a battle royale frenzy instead of a sporting race.

5 Neo Bowser City

A Futuristic City That’s Plagued by Rapidly Sharp Turns

  • Debuted in: Mario Kart 7

Neo Bowser City truly looks like a breathtaking place. That is, until players realize it’s always raining, the sky is condensed with pollution, and Bowser’s face is plastered everywhere. To make matters worse, the faster players go, the greater risk they have of failing. Neo Bowser City has tight alleyways, twisting corners, and tunnels that could shoot players straight out to their demise if they’re not careful. There are so many obstacles and walls to crash into during a run of Neo Bowser City that players might be wishing for a change of scenery with Moo Moo Meadows.

4 Shroom Ridge

A Mountain Ridge Road Where Sharp Turning Leads to Doom

  • Debuted in: Mario Kart DS

Shroom Ridge might be a beautiful mountaintop location, but the traffic makes it anything but. Shroom Ridge features a rather varied method of track design, allowing players to swerve between cars and other racers as they navigate a winding ridge, but there’s a catch. The expansive mountain surface makes for such sharp bends that players aren’t going to be able to see the cars that are coming their way until it’s too late, and players are going to end up spinning out or knocking themselves down the mountain. It’s a deadly track that requires players to stay focused and careful at all times.

3 Ninja Hideaway

Splitting Courses With Ceiling Traps and Ninja Shy Guys

  • Debuted in: Mario Kart Tour

Ninja Hideaway can be a tad overwhelming when it comes to course design. The track itself has retractable ceilings that will chop and change the layout, forcing some players to go up while others go down, and neither knows which is faster. As the map continues to move, players are forced to continue to debate whether they should go up and down, while avoiding ninja variants of Shy Guys and trying to stay stable on the tiled rooftops that they drive across in the hopes that they don’t fall and crash.

2 Bowser’s Castle (MK8)

Fire Obstacles and a Metal Bowser Stop Players in Their Tracks

  • Debuted in: Mario Kart 8

Bowser’s Castle constantly innovates and changes over the years, and it seems each new Mario Kart featured a Bowser’s Castle. While players should feel bad for the architect who has to design Bowser’s Castle, they should also feel sorry for the racers who embark on this specific castle’s halls. With traps galore, players are going to spin out of track and lose their place, especially with the abundance of laser-spewing Bowser, fire-spinning lines, and the dreaded metal Bowser that punches a splitting track repeatedly. Crossing through Bowser’s Castle without getting set on fire or hitting a wall is a hard ask.

1 Rainbow Road (Wii)

The Hardest Rainbow Road With No Safety Rails

  • Debuted in: Mario Kart Wii

While Rainbow Road tracks can be ranked on their own, it’s hard to imagine any of them surpassing the Wii version. Rainbow Road’s Wii track is intense in all senses of the word. There are no railings, no support to stop players from tumbling down to their doom. A simple knock from a larger racer will send players hurtling down, and using a Mushroom is the riskiest thing one can do with such tight corners, with no safety whatsoever. Rainbow Road has many hard turns, and players will be lucky if they complete this track without halting to a stop or falling just once.

Mario Kart World
Racing
Open-World
Systems
Released
June 2, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Everyone // Mild Fantasy Violence, Users Interact

Nintendo

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign: Tips for Solo Players
item.description:
Summary

  • Solo play in Elden Ring Nightreign is challenging due to boss designs and limited resources - maintain a keen eye on the map.
  • Utilize consumables like firebombs strategically for efficient power boosts and consider exploration speed for success.
  • Know the elemental weaknesses of bosses, plan routes effectively, and understand Nightfarer characters' abilities for solo play success.

Elden Ring Nightreign is FromSoftware's debut into true multiplayer Soulslikes, and the game manages to get a lot of things right in terms of creating a compelling co-op experience that many players can enjoy at once. But for players looking for an extra challenge or for those who prefer the lone wolf approach, the option to play solo is there as a way to show off the player's skills and map knowledge in the best way possible.

In a game with multiplayer in mind, it is clear that solo play was never intended to be the main way to play the game. Bosses with multiple targets to juggle, large groups of enemies that can overwhelm individuals in no time, and a revival system that helps those who make mistakes, solo players get the short end of the stick in almost every way possible. But, clearing the Nightlords is more than possible alone, and there are a few tricks and tips that players should think about when entering the world by themselves for the first time.

8 Use The Map To The Fullest

All The Information In The Palm Of Your Hand

When jumping into a run as a group, players have to worry far less about specific routing, as players can instruct others where to go or even break off and complete their own individual tasks for maximum efficiency. But when taking on the fight alone, the player needs to have a good idea about how to navigate the map, which areas to focus on first, and how to progress through each day to ensure no slowing down.

It's always a good idea to check the map while gliding in for the first time, in order to see if there are any close points of interest to focus on first. The rainfall also becomes much more of a threat to be managed, and the margin for error is far lower, so players need to keep an eye on the map at all times to see where the next safe spot is in order to avoid going down and failing the run as a result.

7 Use Consumables

No Shame In Throwing A Few Firebombs

The loot in Nightreign takes several different forms, ranging from stat upgrades to weapons to talismans. But some of the most overlooked yet most important items to collect are the various consumables that can give players a substantial boost to their early power, whilst also giving them something to take into the final fight on night three.

Throwable items like firebombs can be great for taking out large groups from afar, and grease items can be applied frivolously throughout a run to help players deal some extra chunks of damage to tankier enemies. It is worth knowing the kinds of items that are available and keeping an eye out for any merchants that may sell a consumable that could change the course of a run in a big way. And with so many on the map, players can toss as many daggers and urns as they like without fear of running out when the time is right.

6 Speed Is Key

Don't Hang Around For Too Long

Arguably, the biggest learning curve in the game is the shift away from slow, methodical exploration to high-tempo action that demands speed at all times. Slowing down on the map can harm the players in more ways than just dying to the rain, as if they don't level up fast enough by the end of the day, even the first night boss can be too much to overcome.

It's all about learning how to move around the areas in the most efficient way possible, like using spirit springs to leap over larger gaps or skipping certain areas of a camp to move onto more important things. There are even a few ways of squeezing some extra time out of the map, such as leaving the final circle sooner before the damage fades or hanging around in the storm for a bit and hopping between graces in order to grab a few extra runes while the clock isn't ticking.

5 Choose The Right Relics

More Important Than They May Appear

Relics are a new mechanic introduced in Nightreign that act as an upgrade system outside of the normal gameplay loop. Many of the buffs they provide are small passive boosts that affect a small part of the player's stats, but others can dramatically change how an entire run functions. For instance, having a starting weapon that deals bleed damage can mean that certain bosses are accessible earlier, speeding up the leveling process and letting players effectively skip some of the farming steps.

Also, later on, players will gain access to Nightfarer-specific relics that come from remembrances. These unlock powerful changes to the core skills and serve as insanely useful tools to carry players in a big way. It is always worth experimenting with different combinations, especially when using different vessels, as certain characters can be given a whole new lease of life just with a simple swap.

4 Learn The Lords

Elemental Weaknesses And Movesets Galore

The whole goal of a run is to level up quickly and be geared enough to take on the fearsome Nightlord at the end of night three. That goal never changes, but the actual bosses do with each subsequent expedition, which means that players can never just jump into a new run and expect to understand everything that awaits them at the end.

The most important part about tackling a new Nightlord is understanding their elemental weakness. This is seen on the expedition selection screen, giving players effectively a cheat sheet to help them deal way more damage to the hardest boss they will encounter in the run. Also, it might be worth trying a few runs in multiplayer, just to get a better understanding of how the bosses work and to learn their movesets. But for those looking for the ultimate challenge, always respect the elements.

3 Have A Plan

Figure Routes That Work And Areas To Avoid

It's one thing to check the map and understand where to go roughly, but without an actual plan or route in mind, it can be hard to consistently win runs. The map itself never changes, but the smaller locations do, meaning that regardless of what expedition it is or whether there is an event fissure, players can reliably navigate the map in roughly the same way every time. Also, as there are no other pings coming down on the map, solo players need to rely on themselves alone to navigate the world; hence, having a good understanding of the map and the spawns becomes invaluable.

With this knowledge in mind, it is important to think about which areas can be tackled at which points in time. The central castle, for instance, might be best left until the second day, while the churches and smaller forts are much easier targets early on. There's no best route for every situation, so players should experiment and figure out what works for them and their character, switching it up depending on certain spawns and figuring out a general loop to aim for every time.

2 Understand The Nightfarers

Each Character Has Its Tech

The Nightfarers are an integral part of Nightreign that exist as anchors for players to hold onto through all the uncertainty of the world. No matter what happens, the abilities will remain the same, aside from a few buffs and cooldown changes, which means that maximizing every aspect of the character's kit should be a top priority for players looking to go in alone and test their skills.

Really use the Rountable Hold's Sparring Grounds and play around with each character and their abilities. There are more than a few different hidden techniques and additions that can transform certain characters into powerhouses for solo adventures. Certain choices are obviously going to be better or worse alone, so building each Nightfarer accordingly to the lack of players is just as important as choosing one to face the night.

1 Come Back Later

Never Too Late To Gear Up

Everyone is human, and mistakes do happen. It is much better to mess up and try again than to actually die and have to restart the whole run. Without the safety net of revival, solo players need to get comfortable with the idea of running away when things go south, as sometimes a boss will prove to be a bigger challenge than expected and going to reset and come back with a full set of flasks can be a great way of taking down the tougher challenges.

Also, sometimes a route might have players running all the way around the outskirts of the map, whilst leaving a few important areas like a church behind. It is much more efficient to return later on when the route allows it, than to run all the way across the map just to collect a single item. Do things on the way, and anything that is left afterwards can be cleaned up once the important early levels are sorted and the player is ready to grab the final tools before the real boss begins.

8 Images
8 Images

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Ultimate Golf Promo Codes (June 2025)
item.description:
There are many golf fans around the world, but this is a rather expensive hobby, so it is not available to everyone. Fortunately, game developers understand this very well, and that's why you can play Ultimate Golf on your phone. Like many other mobile games, you can unlock and upgrade your equipment. Luckily, you can redeem Ultimate Golf codes to get some equipment for free.

Updated June 2, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Ultimate Golf has several active codes that offer useful in-game rewards. These rewards include golf bags and pins, which can help enhance your experience on the course. It’s a good idea to claim them soon, as codes can expire without warning. Keep an eye on this page, as we regularly check for new updates and will add fresh rewards when they become available.

All Ultimate Golf Codes

Although there are few active codes presently, they will give you a good start in Ultimate Golf . By redeeming one of the codes, you will receive a Gold Bag with a high chance of having an epic club, as well as many balls and pins. Below you will find a list of all active codes, but redeem them as soon as possible because they are expiring rapidly.

Active Codes

  • Back2golf - Enter this code to get a Golf Bag.
  • playpebble - Enter this code to get a Golf Bag.
  • welcome0422 - Enter this code to get a Golf Bag.
  • Player1 - Enter this code to get some Golf Pins.

Expired Codes

  • NYJ
  • SF
  • zach8
  • PALMER24
  • TOMCAT
  • TEEREX
  • BIGEASY
  • THEDON
  • HAPPY
  • BOB
  • CHUBBS
  • SHOOTER
  • Cooper
  • welcome0422
  • jared23
  • erelic23
  • zach8
  • THEBEAST23
  • ZACH22
  • BOOSTME
  • ZENDO77
  • YAY10K
  • Full18
  • Blossom23
  • Lemonade18
  • Marv31
  • SEZAZD3X
  • SWING

How to Redeem Ultimate Golf Codes

Many mobile game developers add the option of redeeming codes to attract interest in their projects. To make it easy for players to find this option, it is usually located in the profile menu. In Ultimate Golf , it's easy to redeem codes, but you won't find them in the profile menu, so you'll have to spend some time exploring the game's HUD. To help you with this, we have created a guide that will show you how to redeem codes in Ultimate Golf .

  • Launch Ultimate Golf .
  • Finish the tutorial and go to the Home tab in the main menu of the game.
  • Under the Play Golf button, you will see a bright orange Free Rewards button. Press it.
  • At the bottom of the screen, you will see the Promo Code. Press Enter to the right of this inscription.
  • A new window will open with a code field. You can either manually enter the code there, or copy it from our list of active codes and click the Paste button below the field.
  • Then press Submit to redeem the code.

How to Get More Ultimate Golf Codes

Sometimes the newest codes are challenging to find and players have to spend a lot of time searching for good sources of information. If you want to be the first to receive new promo codes, you should bookmark this page because we update it monthly. If you are interested in official information from the developers, you can visit Ultimate Golf! page in X. There, you will find not only active promo codes but also information about various updates and events.

Ultimate Golf is available on mobile.

item.title: Bingo Blitz Codes (June 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Bingo Blitz Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Bingo Blitz
  • How to Get More Bingo Blitz Codes

Bingo Blitz is a popular online game that combines classic bingo with exciting power-ups, quests, and other features. Here, you need to be as fast and attentive as possible to not miss the bingo and win before someone else does.

If you are low on currency, which often happens to beginners, you can use Bingo Blitz codes. The rewards from the codes will be both precious currency and other useful bonuses or power-ups, so don't neglect them.

Updated June 2, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There are currently no active Bingo Blitz codes available to redeem right now. We’re always on the lookout for new freebies, so this guide will be updated as soon as any appear. You can check back here from time to time to see if fresh rewards have been added. Staying updated ensures you won’t miss out when new codes go live.

All Bingo Blitz Codes

Working Bingo Blitz Codes

At the moment, there are no working Bingo Blitz codes. To stay tuned, save this page and visit it later.

Expired Bingo Blitz Codes

  • BALLON3
  • BLITZYTT
  • BBGC2
  • CLUE1
  • DREWNEW
  • FBGIFT4U
  • FISHY
  • FLAG
  • GRATEFUL
  • HUNT
  • ice
  • NowThatsBingo
  • PLAYNOW
  • PUMPKINPRANK
  • QUEST
  • RESCUE
  • SPOON
  • TWITTERFIRSTGIFT
  • WHITE

If you are an avid gambler or a beginner, you probably experienced situations when you spent all the currency and couldn't play anymore. Don't worry because by redeeming the codes, you can change this and, moreover, in addition to currency, get other useful rewards, so be sure to take advantage of this opportunity.

How to Redeem Codes for Bingo Blitz

Redeeming Bingo Blitz is not difficult, and will take you a few clicks. However, since it is a mobile game, you will need to complete the tutorial before you can access the redemption option, which will take about 10–15 minutes. Once that's done, follow these steps to redeem the codes:

  • Launch Bingo Blitz .
  • Go to the main menu. Here, pay attention to the upper-right corner of the screen. There will be a hamburger button. Click on it.
  • This will open a side menu with a list of different options. Among them, interact with the fourth one which says Promo Code.
  • This will open the redemption menu. There will be an input field and a Redeem button below it. Now, enter manually, or better yet, copy and paste one of the above-mentioned active codes into the input field.
  • Lastly, click on the Redeem button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, a notification will appear on the screen with a list of rewards received.

How to Get More Bingo Blitz Codes

Just like with Roblox codes, you can find more codes on the game's official social media, and luckily, Bingo Blitz has plenty of them. By keeping a close eye on each of them, you will likely find fresh codes.

  • Official Bingo Blitz X account.
  • Official Bingo Blitz Facebook page.
  • Official Bingo Blitz YouTube channel.
  • Official Bingo Blitz Instagram account.

Bingo Blitz is available on mobile devices.
